title: Pandas: Multiple Conditions
story: Combine multiple conditions using & (AND) and | (OR). Remember to wrap each condition in parentheses!
instructions: Filter rows where age >= 25 AND score > 80. Print the filtered DataFrame.
starterCode:
import pandas as pd

data = {
    'name': ['Alice', 'Bob', 'Charlie', 'David'],
    'age': [23, 28, 32, 25],
    'score': [85, 92, 78, 88]
}
df = pd.DataFrame(data)

# Filter with multiple conditions
filtered = df[(df['age'] >= 25) & (df['score'] > 80)]
print(filtered)
solutionHidden:
import pandas as pd

data = {
    'name': ['Alice', 'Bob', 'Charlie', 'David'],
    'age': [23, 28, 32, 25],
    'score': [85, 92, 78, 88]
}
df = pd.DataFrame(data)
filtered = df[(df['age'] >= 25) & (df['score'] > 80)]
print(filtered)

tests.description: Should show Bob and David (both meet age >= 25 and score > 80)

hints.text: Use & for AND, | for OR. Wrap each condition in parentheses: (cond1) & (cond2)
